values:
East Side Artist's Boutique - Fundraiser for the Hunger Task Force
Type your cut contents here. Attached are the application and rules and regulations.  You can mail the application to the address on the bottom of the application.  The sooner you commit, the better, as it will help me budget for promotions. Please read the rules and let me know if you have questions.
 
Here is the run-down for your convenience:
  • Benefit for Hunger Task Force
  • Friday, December 15 from 5:00 pm to 9:00 pm & Saturday, December 16 from 12:00 pm to 5:00 pm
  • It is not necessary to participate in both days, although I hope you do
  • To be held at UWM Kenilworth Building, 1925 East Kenilworth Place, Milwaukee 53202
  • It is $15 a day for vendors - money will be used to help promote the event
  • I kindly ask each vendor to donate one piece of art to donate to a silent auction to raise additional funds for the Hunger Task Force - if at all possible, please send me a picture of what you are donating for my website and the Hunger Task Force website.  If that is not possible, please send me a description
  • There will be a $5 cover charge for shoppers - 100% goes to Hunger Task Force
  • I ask that vendors please bring their own table and chairs (I will let you know if that changes, as there is a possibilty I will provide them for a minimal fee)
  • The vendor space will be at least 10 x 10
  • I will be asking local restaurants to donate appeatisers for Friday night
  • There will be wine sales Friday night a portion of which will go to the Hunger Task Force
Please encourage friends and family to attend.  If you are interested in having flyers for the event, please let me know. Additionally, if you have friends you think might be interested, please have them contact me. 
 
Peace,
 
Laura

For more information www.laurarichardconsulting.com

AND....

All is looking fantastic for the event.  We have gotten two large cash sponsors and a couple smaller cash sponsors.  Additionally, we have a number of inkind sponsorships such as WMSE and Clark Graphics.  There will be articles written in a few publications.  Friday night we have 7 restaurants donating appetizers and Beans will be doing wine sales. 

I have 25 committed artists thus far, but would love to have you join us.  Please let me know if you are able to attend.  I have attached the application and rules/reg again for your convenience.

Again, if you know by Nov. 15th, I will be mentioning participating vendors in an article I am writing for one of the publications.
http://myrenegadecraft.livejournal.com/12538.html

Our 5th Art vs Craft apparence on Nov 4th and 5th was a success. Amy's screen printed shirts were flying off the rack. (Everyone loves Christopher Walken. its true. We simply cannot get enough) We also had a new craft-tress with us: Aileen. She sold her Unhappy Valentines and Lovebirds cards, and brightened up the booth with her canvases. 



Etsy has been down for maintence but we should be posting 8 new kittentents and lots of t-shirts this week sometime! 



Check out www.vainglory.etsy.com later this week!

One last thing!

located next to Comet Cafe. Please stop by and check out this new shop- great stuff!

For easier perusal, this entry has several links to posts featuring Vainglory's crafty goodness. Bath Bombs and Cuffs Lots and Lots of Kitten Tents A few felt hair clips and flower pins More Cuffs, Tents, and Felt Hair Clips Vainglory's ETSY Shop! Booth pics from last November's Art vs Craft and MadCraftmas In our fourth incarnation at the Art vs Craft Fair, Vainglory still is going strong with fashion-inspired accessory creation. Mainly focused on felt hair clips and a variety of wristcuffs made from recycled leather and cloth, we also offer a smattering of items crafted with love from the depths of our obsessions. Cat tents, beaded jewelry, anthropomorphic felt magnets, and PVC pipe didgeridoos have all made their appearances. We are anticipating another very successful run at this spring's fifth Art-vs-Craft fair. Thank you for considering us! <3 Angie, Emily, & Amy
http://myrenegadecraft.livejournal.com/11410.html

Time once again for a PHOTO UPDATE! We have been busy creating wonders that astound. Here are just a couple of pics from the archives.....
Starting with my new favorite:

BATH BOMBS.

These are made with high quality Almond oil, baking soda, corn starch, and (sometimes) fragrance and color. I get to use the non-perfect ones on myself and they fizz and burble in the most amusing fashion! Truly, these make bath time so much fun. Very popular at past Art-vs-Craft Fairs and MadCraftmas, Vainglory will once again be selling our leather and cloth

Wristcuffs

. These are made using an ANVIL! It's the little things that make our work extra special.

Don't forget to check out the store at: www.vainglory.etsy.com for more!
http://myrenegadecraft.livejournal.com/11240.html
http://myrenegadecraft.livejournal.com/11561.html

i tried my first bath bombs today! The 1st ones I made were too wet and started to sprout warts and sagged into odd lumps rather than staying put in nice orbs. I mashed those into some more dry ingredients and all was well. I separated out some of the mixture and tried a ylang ylang aveda oil for scent. It seems to be working really well. The scent is strong with these ones. In a bit of the rest I put a concord grape concentrate natural food color. I had to really mash it into the dry ingredients to get the color right, and still it was very pale or speckly (kinda cute...) these ones ended up with a concord grape scent. Here's some pics of the finished products:
You can't see the speckly color at all in the pics. The ones with the weird leeches on the tops are the ylang ylang scented ones. These are approx. 2 oz each. I will be making more for the Art-vs-Craft fair this June!
http://myrenegadecraft.livejournal.com/10597.html

St. Paul Craftstravaganza! Vendor INFORMATION! The official due date for applications is March 6, and the fair has been confirmed for July 8. Those are dates you can write down in pen. The St. Paul Craftstravaganza is cast in the mold of urban craft fairs like Bazaar Bizarre, Renegade, the DIY Trunk Show, Art vs. Craft, and the local No Coast Craft-o-Rama. The first inaugural Craftstravaganza is a one-day indoor market for the new breed of indie craftsters, artists and designers to set up shop for a day and showcase their creations. In addition to our 50+ expected vendors, we will have workshops and classes throughout the day, live music, raffles, entertainment for youngsters, good fresh food... and more! Here is their website: http://craftstravaganza.com/index.html

MILWAUKEE OSTARA FESTIVAL Saturday, APRIL 1, 2006 HART PARK, Noon to 6pm With Special Guest - Isaac Bonewits on Sunday evening (tickets for sale now!) The Milwaukee Pagan Unity Council is holding its fifth annual Ostara Festival this year. MPUC is a local non-profit that hosts the Ostara Festival every year, and is a supporter of Pagan Pride Day. We attempt to build community among all Milwaukee people, and open up opportunities for education about the pagan community as well as events that welcome all walks. We are in full swing for bringing in vendors, workshops, performers, and more. We have some tarot readers, chair massage, and possibly even reiki practitioners as well as many local vendors from organic coffee companies to Herb stores to new age stores. Performances will include bellydancers, Nia, trancedance, and hopefully more! What are we missing? We are looking for more people to be involved. Please contact me directly at irondawn@gmail.com to get forms and information, or send me your email address and I'll forward that information. Or if you prefer to have it mailed to you, send me your mailing address (always kept private) and we will send you information in our next mailing. (We never sell personal information.) Vendors: We are open to all sorts of vendors if you think your wares will be of interest to the community. We've had past vendors such as booksellers, new age stores, Moonwise Herbs, clothing vendors, henna artists, reiki masters, tarot readers, bellydance costuming, jewlery dealers, artists, and much more. If you think the community would be interested, why don't you give it a try? Contact irondawn@gmail.com, or revonatah@yahoo.com for more information on how to be a part of this great event.

Friends of the Dragon Art Fair
The Friends of the Dragon Art Fair presents artists' original, handcrafted works, not the work of mass production studios. We are an up and coming art fair, looking for great artists to make this an exciting event everyone will want to be part of.

Type of Opportunity: Call for artists
Contact information: Contact Merry Poast at 608-846-9792 or Julie Wills at 608-846-8891 or by e-mail at jwills@dragonartsgroup.org 
URL: dragonartsgroup.org
http://myrenegadecraft.livejournal.com/9206.html

Hi and Happy New Year!

We are now accepting applications for this year\'s Renegade Craft Fair BROOKLYN! There are 150 spots available, and the fair will take place June 17 + 18 in Williamsburg\'s McCarren Park from 11am - 6pm. Read the FAQ and find out how to join!

In the event that we are overwhelmed with applicants, we may decide to add another weekend in June and hold two fairs back-to-back each with a unique line-up! The tentative dates for a second fair are June 10 + 11. Check back in March for more details, or sign up for the mailing list to receive our newsletter + updates.

Check out our new website for 2006 which includes an updated scrapbook and a brand new forum where you chat with other crafty peeps. Also, please make a note of our new email address, renegadecraftfair@gmail.com.

Thanks and email us with any questions!

Sue Blatt + Kathleen Habbley
http://www.renegadecraftfair.com

The Bayview Bash on Sat. was great. We had a lot of interest, lots of inquries as to where we sold our stuff, lots of requests for cards and spread the word about our next event in November. Pretty damn good for a one-day street festival. Emily and I are feeling very excited for the Art-vs-Craft Fair on Nov. 18th and 19th! We did some screen printing this time around and it got lots of compliments. Big Thanks to Ben for lending us his tent!

I have not updated our site in a realy long time. eeek!

The Art vs Craft fair was great! we did fabulously and had a lot of interest. I sold kitty tents and fred sold digeridoos! I wasn't sure if the higher prices on these items would prohibit buyers, but they sold and i was so happy. :) They will be reappearing, for sure. 

We have applied for a booth at the upcoming Bayview Bash! The Bash is on Sept. 17th. No news yet, but the deadline is Aug 28th, i think, so we should know soon. 

We have also applied for the 3rd incarnation of the Art vs Craft Fair. We will know Sept 1st if we have a spot there. It will be a 2-day event again, in November! glee!

Pics coming very soon (i promise) of the craft fair and our current projects.

Thanks for your support!
Angie

There will be another Art -vs- Craft Fair! We are so excited! here is a preview of some of the things you will be able to find at our booth in 2005---

  

This handbag is one-of-a-kind. I patterned it using green upholstery fabric with a strong purple lining.  The leather strap is held tightly together with d-rings and studs. A Pair if Earrings by Emily and an example of some bead work (Angie).

; 

The Fishing Lure Necklaces got a lot of oohs and ahhs (and ewwws) last year

  

Although our focus is shifting away from accessories, we still will have plenty of flower pins, one of the most popular items we had last year! Some sparklie Earrings.

 If you have ALWAYS wanted to sneak out of Target with one of those tiny tents from the camping dept... Be sure to stop  and check out the KittyTent. this is a picture of the prototype, and will come in a LOT of colors.

Although VainGlory has yet to hear a confirmation, we are hoping to repeat the success of last year. We will keep you updated, but we will not know for awhile if we have been accepted to the event.
